subject: Sleep
title: Scandinavian Outdoor Baby Naps
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Scandinavian Outdoor Baby Naps.

hook.text: In Denmark and Sweden, parents leave babies napping outside in strollers, even in freezing winter temperatures.

buildup.text: The practice began in the early 1900s when fresh air was considered essential for preventing tuberculosis.

discovery.text: Research shows outdoor-napping babies sleep longer and deeper than indoor nappers, possibly due to temperature regulation.

twist.text: Tourists are shocked to see rows of strollers outside cafes with sleeping babies in subzero weather.

climax.text: In Scandinavia this is completely normal. In other countries, it might trigger a call to child protective services.

punchline.text: What counts as good parenting depends entirely on where you live.

quiz.question: Why do Scandinavian parents let babies nap outdoors in winter?
options: The tradition promotes longer, deeper sleep and originated from fresh air health beliefs
